cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi ENE of Cape Canaveral Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast tonight and Sunday, then accelerating northeast on Monday, passing near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks and remaining offshore of the Mid-Atlantic before heading out into the open western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (a Tropical Storm Warning may be required for parts of the NC coast Sunday morning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells and fringe tropical-storm conditions possible from east-central Florida northward to the Mid-Atlantic coast, with greatest impacts along the North Carolina coast.
weather_observation.wind: Only a 3 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds; brief gusty conditions possible Monday nightâ€“Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surf-generated run-up and dangerous rip currents possible along the Atlantic beaches; no significant surge expected inside Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands may brush the area Monday night-Tuesday with totals generally <1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents along the Maryland Atlantic shoreline could disrupt pilot transfers and lightering operations.
